identificationModule.briefTitle: Planter Pressure and Body Mass Index Affect Balance in Normal Children
identificationModule.officialTitle: Does Planter Pressure and Body Mass Index Affect Balance in Normal Children

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: associate professor of pediatric physiotherapy, cairo university

descriptionModule.briefSummary: is there relation between planter pressure, body mass index and balance in normal children?
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: is there relation between planter pressure, body mass index and balance in normal children?

primaryOutcomes.measure: Foot pressure will be recorded by a pedograph
primaryOutcomes.description: Foot pressure will be recorded by a pedograph

primaryOutcomes.measure: BMI will be calculated by weight/height^2 (CDC chart).
primaryOutcomes.description: BMI will be calculated by weight/height\^2 (CDC chart).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Balance will be assessed by Biodex
primaryOutcomes.description: Balance will be assessed by Biodex

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Normal children from both sex
* Age from 8 to 12 years

Exclusion Criteria:

* recent fractures or procedures
* open wounds on the lower limbs,
* any fixed deformities in the lower limbs
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: One hundred normal children aged from 8 to 12 years old will participate in this study.
